QCAlgorithm provides a shortcut method, SWISS(), for the SwissArmyKnife indicator. It creates an Indicator object, sets up a consolidator to update the indicator, and then returns the indicator so you can use it in your algorithm.

The following reference table describes the SWISS method:

SWISS()1/1

            SwissArmyKnife QuantConnect.Algorithm.QCAlgorithm.SWISS (
    Symbol                       symbol,
    Int32                        period,
    Double                       delta,
    SwissArmyKnifeTool           tool,
    *Nullable<Resolution>  resolution,
    *Func<Decimal>         selector
   )

Creates Swiss Army Knife transformation for the symbol. The indicator will be automatically updated on the given resolution.

Parameters
Symbol symbol The symbol to use for calculations.
Int32 period The period of the calculation.
Double delta The delta scale of the BandStop or BandPass.
SwissArmyKnifeTool tool The tool os the Swiss Army Knife. Options: ['Gauss', 'Butter', 'HighPass', 'TwoPoleHighPass', 'BandPass']
*Nullable<Resolution> resolution (Optional) The resolution.
*Func<Decimal> selector (Optional) elects a value from the BaseData to send into the indicator, if None defaults to the Value property of BaseData (x => x.Value).

Return

SwissArmyKnife - The calculation using the given tool

Definition at line 1896 of file Algorithm/QCAlgorithm.Indicators.cs.


The resolution of the indicator should be greater than or equal to the resolution of the security.

To retrieve the numerical value of the indicator, use its Current.Value attribute.

private SwissArmyKnife _swiss;
// In Initialize()
var symbol = AddEquity("SPY").Symbol;
_swiss = SWISS(symbol, period, delta, tool);

// In OnData()
if (_swiss.IsReady)
{
    var indicatorValue = _swiss.Current.Value;
}
# In Initialize()
symbol = self.AddEquity("SPY").Symbol
self.swiss = self.SWISS(symbol, period, delta, tool)

# In OnData()
if self.swiss.IsReady:
    indicator_value = self.swiss.Current.Value
